overview:
Sig Mosley is President of Imlay Investments, Inc., a firm owned by John P. Imlay, Jr. that makes direct equity investments, typically in new technology companies. As President, Sig selects companies for investment, structures deals, and oversees the Imlay Investment portfolio.

Previously, Sig was a Vice President of Management Science America, Inc. (now Dun & Bradstreet Software Services, Inc.) where he directed the company’s finance and accounting functions. Additionally, he worked for Peat Marwick & Mitchell as a staff accountant.

Sig serves on the board of directors of Ardext Technologies, Inc., Bank Intelligence, Contract Packaging, Inc., eQuorum Corporation, EzGov, Inc., Fountainhead Water Company, Inc., Kelly Registration, Inc., MCF Systems, Inc., Photobooks, Inc., and USBA Holdings, Inc. In addition, he is a director of The Imlay Foundation, Inc., and a venture partner with Armada Venture Group.

Sig received a Bachelor of Business Administration from Emory University, Atlanta.
